column4: Holy sheepshit, Batman.  I just thought I'd install xemacs for a looksee.  It wants 103 MB of disk space!! For an editor!!   Now that's bloat.
use apt-cache search to find things
Thanks!  Yeah, emacs21 is the ticket.
Wow, "apt-cache search" seems just the ticket.  thanks.
ubuntu has all kinds of tickets ;-) ;-)
So I'm finding out.  :-)  I'm growing to like Ubuntu very much.  Especially now that KDE is available for it.
ubuntu is more than just "desktop" debian :)
it kicks butt for servers too, it just happens to have a really awesome desktop
Not arguing against using Ubuntu for servers but why wouldn't you use regular Debian for that?
because ubuntu is newer, has excellent security support, etc.
big difference betweeen warty and woody :)
Yeah, woody is old now.  But sarge isn't.
Let's agree, then, that Ubuntu makes for a truly excellent desktop Linux.
